intro: Pleurogyne patens, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period and ability to attract pollinators.
